DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Part 1 - Determine willingness healthy participant enroll genetic environmental risk assessment colorectal cancer . - Determine impact decision counsel knowledge attitude genetic environmental risk assessment ( GERA ) colorectal cancer screen participant . - Determine participant ' understand GERA . - Determine participant ' response GERA result . Part 2 - Determine awareness , interest , diet genetic assessment colorectal cancer among healthy participant average risk colorectal cancer undergone regular colon cancer screen . - Determine participant ' level knowledge assessment . - Determine participant ' rate acceptance study . OUTLINE : This 2-part pilot study . - Part 1 : Participants complete baseline questionnaire attitude , belief , knowledge colorectal cancer ( CRC ) , CRC screening , diet genetic test colorectal cancer risk . Two-four week later , participant educate CRC screen option undergo genetic environmental risk assessment ( GERA ) decision counsel methylene tetrahydrofolate reductase ( MTHFR ) gene dietary folate intake . Participants decide undergo GERA undergo blood test MTHFR polymorphisms folate level . Participants whose blood test indicate low folate level counsel dietary folate intake . - Part 2 : Participants complete questionnaire attitude , belief , knowledge CRC , CRC screening , diet genetic test colorectal cancer risk . Participants part 1 follow 1 week , 1 month , 6 month . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 110 participant ( 60 part 1 50 part 2 ) accrue study .
